KH.content: entire discourse on khōra, every yet-to-come history of interpretations, included in advance, this X receives all, teleologically programs history of hermeneutics[?], is that a history?
KH.linkedContent: entire discourse on khōra, every yet-to-come history of interpretations, included in advance, this X receives all, teleologically programs history of hermeneutics[?], is that a history?

FL.content: deconstruction is possible as an experience of the impossible, wherever one can replace, translate, determine the X of justice, wherever there is (the undeconstructible)
FL.linkedContent: deconstruction is possible as an experience of the impossible, wherever one can replace, translate, determine the X of justice, wherever there is (the undeconstructible)

LOBL.content: X of L’arrêt de mort, ichthus, (see +R), fish out of water, Christ-like figure of “who,” resurrection [see p. 168 raising an X, chi, chiasma over him]
LOBL.linkedContent: X of L’arrêt de mort, ichthus, (see +R), fish out of water, Christ-like figure of “who,” resurrection [see p. 168 raising an X, chi, chiasma over him]

HASD.content: X (text, writing, trace, differance, hymen, supplement, pharmakon, parergon) : not subject to Aufhebung, dialectic, neither concept nor name > lends itself to a series of names, calls for another syntax, exceeds order and structure of predicative discourse [has induced accusation against Derrida of repeating procedures of negative theology]
HASD.linkedContent: X (text, writing, trace, differance, hymen, supplement, pharmakon, parergon) : not subject to Aufhebung, dialectic, neither concept nor name > lends itself to a series of names, calls for another syntax, exceeds order and structure of predicative discourse [has induced accusation against Derrida of repeating procedures of negative theology]

POO.content: X (a child, Pierre, a trace) does not need your, the father’s name, does not return your, the father’s name [Derrida’s thinly veiled reference to Pierre]
POO.linkedContent: X (a child, Pierre, a trace) does not need your, the father’s name, does not return your, the father’s name [Derrida’s thinly veiled reference to Pierre]

POO.content: Philoctetus: the child is the problem [shield], always, that is the truth
POO.linkedContent: Philoctetus: the child is the problem [shield], always, that is the truth

PAS.content: X that is l’oubli tout autre is also the same X of philosophy, science
PAS.linkedContent: X that is l’oubli tout autre is also the same X of philosophy, science

POS.content: X as chiasm [btwn philosophy & literature?]: a fork (crossroads, quadrifurcum, grid, trellis, key) > more unequal at one point than other: figure of double gesture, intersection
POS.linkedContent: X as chiasm [btwn philosophy & literature?]: a fork (crossroads, quadrifurcum, grid, trellis, key) > more unequal at one point than other: figure of double gesture, intersection

POS.content: can be hastily thought of as thematic drawing of dissemination
POS.linkedContent: can be hastily thought of as thematic drawing of dissemination

O.content: acc. X (chiasmus) (thematic diagram of dissemination), semen just as likely to get lost as seminal differance as it is to be reappropriated by sublimity of father
O.linkedContent: acc. X (chiasmus) (thematic diagram of dissemination), semen just as likely to get lost as seminal differance as it is to be reappropriated by sublimity of father

D.content: X not an unknown but chiasmus, a text that is unreadable because only readable > Numbers undecipherable because you imposed encryption on them by trying to decipher them
D.linkedContent: X not an unknown but chiasmus, a text that is unreadable because only readable > Numbers undecipherable because you imposed encryption on them by trying to decipher them

HST.content: X, great 3rd, God accords/grants forgiveness, renders substitution possible

+R.content: fishing picture, record of a hunt: 2 death drives cross in an X (double diagonal): 1) pushes, attracts, holds down—descending column 2) the other, just as sublime, raises up, asphyxia of the phallus—ascending column
+R.linkedContent: fishing picture, record of a hunt: 2 death drives cross in an X (double diagonal): 1) pushes, attracts, holds down—descending column 2) the other, just as sublime, raises up, asphyxia of the phallus—ascending column

+R.content: X signs: a crossing privileged by all texts sold under my name [bibliography of Derrida’s use of X]
+R.linkedContent: X signs: a crossing privileged by all texts sold under my name [bibliography of Derrida’s use of X]

+R.content: X (chiasmus), general intersection of Glas, its beginnings or ends en bandes tordues et écartées, also demiurgic operation in Timaeus [see quote: turn X into 2 circles, split Other from Same]
+R.linkedContent: X (chiasmus), general intersection of Glas, its beginnings or ends en bandes tordues et écartées, also demiurgic operation in Timaeus [see quote: turn X into 2 circles, split Other from Same]

+R.content: quotation [Adami] cut out of Glas: outbidding speculating to infinity
+R.linkedContent: quotation [Adami] cut out of Glas: outbidding speculating to infinity

SPEC.content: quasi-proper name is the X that speculates [re: Freud’s Beyond…] w/out identity: sets in place proper trap of its suspension, limits itself in order to increase itself—if it did not limit itself: absolute discharge, disbanding, nothingness of death
SPEC.linkedContent: quasi-proper name is the X that speculates [re: Freud’s Beyond…] w/out identity: sets in place proper trap of its suspension, limits itself in order to increase itself—if it did not limit itself: absolute discharge, disbanding, nothingness of death
